p: We initially screened the crude methanolic extract of Streptomyces sp. strain DBT34 at a high concentration (500 µg/mL) for cytotoxicity against three cancer cell lines (MCF7, AGS and HepG2). The maximum anti-proliferative effect (cytotoxicity) was found against the HepG2 cell line with an IC 50 concentration of 49.2 µg/mL. Khieu et al. [ 33] also reported that Streptomyces sp. strain HUST012 exhibited substantial cytotoxicity against HepG2 cells with an IC 50 concentration of 41.63 µg/mL. Additionally, Lee et al. [ 34] reported that an ethanolic extract of Streptomyces sp. strain MJM 10778 exhibited cytotoxicity against HepG2 cell lines at an IC 50 concentration of 264.7 µg/mL.
